newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Four die in Colombian transport plane crash.
newsitem.headline: Four die in Colombian transport plane crash.

text.p: A small cargo plane transporting newspapers crashed in northwest Colombia, killing four people, officials said on Sunday.
The Russian-made twin-motor Antonov aircraft crashed late Saturday just a minute before it was scheduled to land at Rionegro airport, near Medellin, Colombia's third largest city.
Luis Fernando Duque, head of the Red Cross in Antioquia province, where the accident occurred, said all on board, three men and a woman, died on impact.
"Nearby inhabitants said they heard a plane flying very low overhead then there was a loud bang followed by an explosion. It is not yet clear, however, what caused the crash," he said.
The aircraft was owned by a company called Selva and transported daily newspapers from the capital Bogota to Medellin.

At the end of last month, a Canadian-built twin Otter plane ploughed into a mountain minutes after taking off from Enrique Oyala Herrera airport, Medellin's second airport. All but onbe of the 15 people on board were killed.
